Youxī says: As stated in the preceding preface: when the scripture is recited once, the great deities of the Eastern Direction arrive floating through the air.

The Immeasurable Deliverer of People, the Great Sage of Eternal Life, the Flying Heavenly Divine King of the Southern Infinite.
Dong says: The Southern Infinite Heavens of the Southern Direction are the Great Thousand World of Abandoning Worthies in the Wondrous Pear City.

Youxī says: When the scripture is recited twice, the great deities of the Southern Direction arrive floating through the air.

The Immeasurable Deliverer of People, the Great Sage of Eternal Life, the Flying Heavenly Divine King of the Western Infinite.
Dong says: The Western Infinite Heavens of the Western Direction are the Great Thousand World of Universal Practice in the Blessed Hall Continent.

Youxī says: When the scripture is recited thrice, the great deities of the Western Direction arrive floating through the air.

The Immeasurable Deliverer of People, the Great Sage of Eternal Life, the Flying Heavenly Divine King of the Northern Infinite.
Dong says: The Northern Infinite Heavens of the Northern Direction are the Great Thousand World of Cool Purity in the Fragrant Sandalwood Wilds.

Youxī says: When the scripture is recited four times, the great deities of the Northern Direction arrive floating through the air.

The Immeasurable Deliverer of People, the Great Sage of Eternal Life, the Flying Heavenly Divine King of the Northeastern Infinite.
Dong says: The Northeastern Infinite Heavens of the Northeastern Direction are the Great Thousand World of Eternal Peace in the Blessed Assembly Capital.

Youxī says: When the scripture is recited five times, the great deities of the Northeastern Direction arrive floating through the air.

The Immeasurable Deliverer of People, the Great Sage of Eternal Life, the Flying Heavenly Divine King of the Southeastern Infinite.
Dong says: The Southeastern Infinite Heavens of the Southeastern Direction are the Great Thousand World of Employing Worthies in the Primordial Blessed Field.

Youxī says: When the scripture is recited six times, the great deities of the Southeastern Direction arrive floating through the air.

The Immeasurable Deliverer of People, the Great Sage of Eternal Life, the Flying Heavenly Divine King of the Southwestern Infinite.
Dong says: The Southwestern Infinite Heavens of the Southwestern Direction are the Great Thousand World of Benevolent Stillness in the Extended Blessing Village.

Youxī says: When the scripture is recited seven times, the great deities of the Southwestern Direction arrive floating through the air.

The Immeasurable Deliverer of People, the Great Sage of Eternal Life, the Flying Heavenly Divine King of the Northwestern Infinite.
Dong says: The Northwestern Infinite Heavens of the Northwestern Direction are the Great Thousand World of Extending Worthies in the Blessed Virtue Wilds.

Youxī says: When the scripture is recited eight times, the great deities of the Northwestern Direction arrive floating through the air.

The Immeasurable Deliverer of People, the Great Sage of Eternal Life, the Flying Heavenly Divine King of the Upper Infinite.
Dong says: The Upper Infinite Heavens of the Upper Direction are within the Purple Tenuity of the Jade Treasury of the Mysterious Capital’s peakless summit, where the boundless hosts of Flying Heavenly Divine Kings reside.

Youxī says: When the scripture is recited nine times, the great deities of the Upper Direction arrive floating through the air.

The Immeasurable Deliverer of People, the Great Sage of Eternal Life, the Flying Heavenly Divine King of the Lower Infinite.
Dong says: The Lower Infinite Heavens of the Lower Direction are among the Five Marchmounts and Five Thearchs, within the Northern Fengdu of the Cavernous Yang and Pure Numinosity, and the various bureaus therein.

Youxī says: When the scripture is recited ten times, the great deities of the Lower Direction arrive floating through the air.

The Immeasurable Great Deities, the Great Sages of Eternal Life, the Flying Heavenly Divine Kings of the Ten Directions’ Perfected Realized Ones.
Dong says: In the Great Veil Heavens of the Ten Directions, there is the Jade Capital Mountain, which has eight directions; above and below together make ten directions. Each contains infinite and boundless Flying Heavenly Divine Kings, Lords of Eternal Life and Deliverance, Immeasurable Great Deities, and boundless hosts, all arriving before the Emperor.

Youxī says: These Perfected Deities of the Ten Directions all preside over and oversee the affairs of attaining the Dao, achieving realization, eternal life, and deliverance—hence they are called the Great Sages of Eternal Life and Immeasurable Deliverers of People.

All ride upon flying clouds, crimson chariots, green carriages, feathered canopies, and jade wheels.
Dong says: Flying clouds are of three kinds: white clouds, crimson clouds, and green clouds.

chunks.original_text: 羽，旄也； 盖，覆也； 琼，玉也。 十方大圣、飞天神王各乘丹霞之舆，碧霞之辇，朱雀、凤凰，以为舆辇之盖，七宝轮毂也。 ○玄英曰：丹是赤色之霞，绿是碧霄之炁，此明十方大圣来朝元始之时，皆结太上三素飞云、丹霞碧霄为其车乘，故云丹舆绿辇。 参驾朱凤，五色玄龙， 东曰：参，杂也。 杂驾朱雀、凤凰、五色之龙、白虎、玄武也。 ○幽栖曰：羽盖荫舆辇之上，飞云骋轮毂之下，朱凤则参辇，玄龙则驾舆，於是凤辇、云舆、云炁双迈。 羽盖者，仙禽灵鸟之羽为盖也。 琼轮者，以珪璧琬琰之宝为轮。 ○玄英曰：龙有五色而言玄者，玄犹天也，谓天龙也。 又云玄是众色之主，故特举以明之。 建九色之节，十绝灵旛。 东曰：节，盖也。 旛，华旛也。 九色者，青、赤、白、黄、黑、绿、红、紫、绀也。 上真执九色之旄节，玉女把十绝之灵旛。 ○幽栖曰：夫上真皆建三七九色节，紫旄节、灵旛节，以十色间错，色各一绝，故云十绝。 节在旛前，皆左右持，执以导前。 ○少微曰：十方大圣并乘三素飞云丹霄之辇，凤凰羽盖、琼玉之轮。 参，杂也。 又杂驾以朱凤、玄龙，文耀五色，玉女建九光之节，真人持十绝之旛，文物威仪，异方同轨。 ○玄英曰：十绝灵旛者，以十色之素横幅剪断谓之为绝，又分间其色，接而缝之； 其幅通者，十接谓之十绝。 击於竿首，谓之为旛。 旛者以转为名，令人转祸为福也。 执节使刑罚有度，罪无滥刑，持旛使悔过修真，化恶为善。 大圣所建，晓示愚迷，使真人执旛，玉女持节，其旌节贵贱随法，高低如上清真人建紫毛之节，其余等级具列科仪，此不兼哉。 前啸九凤齐唱，后吹八鸾同鸣， 东曰：雄曰凤，雌曰凰，赤色五彩曰鸾。 前导九部之凤，后从八部之鸾，侍晨一啸，九凤齐唱，西灵真人吹九凤之箫，则八鸾同鸣也。 ○幽栖曰：前有啸歌，凤与之齐唱，后吹管钥，则八鸾与之同呜。 ○玄英曰：八九者，前部属阳，阳数奇，故九也。 后部属阴，阴数偶，故八也。 师子白鹤，啸歌邕邕， 东曰：邕邕，和鸣也。 凤唱鸾呜，众音并作也。 ○幽栖曰：师子作虎啸，白鹤为凤歌，和呜谐合，二音邕穆也。 ○少微曰：此天钧乐也。 前部啸歌则九凤齐唱，后部流吹则八鸾同鸣。 《洞神经》曰：天一左宫有天钧乐器，子日玉女能吹笙竽，丑日玉女能啸歌，寅日玉女能鼓瑟，卯日玉女能击筑，辰日玉女能鼓琴，巳日玉女能撞钟击磬，午日玉女能吹箫，未日玉女能吹笳，申日玉女能为九音之歌，酉日玉女能为六变之歌，戌日玉女能作百兽呜，亥日玉女能为天下新声之曲。 天钧，乐器名也。 名与世同，音与俗异，俗音凄思以促命，天音和畅以延生。 ○玄英曰：此明师子、白鹤从驾而行，天乐一张则百兽率舞，故得齐声唱和，啸歌邕邕。 五老启涂，群仙翼辕， 东曰：五老，五帝也。 启，开也。 涂，道也。 翼，侍也。 辕舆，辇辕也。 十方飞天无极大神临轩於始青天中，五帝开道，群仙侍引也。 ○幽栖曰：五老启涂以前引，群仙则侍辕之左右。 五老即五老帝君，掌领五篇真文也。 ○少微曰：五老，五帝也。 十方大圣道位尊高，乃感五帝，前驱群仙，骖胜乘五符。 《本行经》云：东方安宝华林青灵始老号曰青帝，姓合，讳开，字灵威仰，服色尚青，驾苍龙，建翠旗，从群神九十万人，和春气、生万物。
chunks.translated_text:
Feathers are pennants; canopies are coverings; *qiong* is jade. The Great Sages of the Ten Directions and the Flying Heavenly Divine Kings each ride upon crimson-cloud chariots and azure-cloud carriages, with Vermilion Birds and phoenixes as the canopies for their chariots and carriages, and seven-jeweled wheel hubs.

Xuan Ying says: Crimson is the rosy glow of dawn, and green is the azure *qi* of the heavens. This clarifies that when the Great Sages of the Ten Directions come to pay homage to the Primordial Beginning, they all form the Supreme Three Pure flying clouds, crimson dawn clouds, and azure celestial clouds into their vehicles—hence the terms "crimson chariots" and "green carriages." They harness Vermilion Phoenixes and five-colored Dark Dragons.

Dong says: *Can* means "to intermingle." They intermingle their harnesses with Vermilion Birds, phoenixes, five-colored dragons, White Tigers, and Dark Warriors.

Youxī says: Feathered canopies shade the chariots and carriages above, while flying clouds race beneath the wheel hubs. Vermilion Phoenixes intermingle with the carriages, and Dark Dragons draw the chariots. Thus, phoenix carriages, cloud chariots, and cloud-*qi* advance in tandem. Feathered canopies are made from the feathers of immortal birds and numinous fowl. Jade wheels are crafted from precious jades such as *gui*, *bi*, *wan*, and *yan*.

Xuan Ying says: Dragons come in five colors, yet they are called "Dark" because *xuan* signifies Heaven—referring to Heavenly Dragons. It is also said that *xuan* is the master of all colors, hence it is specifically mentioned to clarify this.

They erect nine-colored standards and ten *jue*-spirit banners.

Dong says: *Jie* are canopies; *fan* are ornate banners. The nine colors are blue-green, crimson, white, yellow, black, green, red, purple, and deep blue. Perfected Ones hold nine-colored feathered standards, while Jade Maidens grasp ten *jue*-spirit banners.

Youxī says: The Perfected Ones all erect three, seven, or nine-colored standards—purple-feathered standards and spirit-banner standards—interspersed with ten colors, each color forming one *jue*, hence the term "ten *jue*." The standards are held before the banners, grasped in both hands to lead the way.

Shaowei says: The Great Sages of the Ten Directions all ride upon Three Pure flying clouds and crimson-cloud carriages, with phoenix-feathered canopies and jade wheels. *Can* means "to intermingle," and they further intermingle their harnesses with Vermilion Phoenixes and Dark Dragons, their radiance displaying five colors. Jade Maidens erect nine-light standards, while Perfected Ones hold ten *jue*-spirit banners. Their regalia and majestic decor are uniform across all directions.

Xuan Ying says: The ten *jue*-spirit banners are made by cutting horizontal strips of ten-colored silk, each strip severed to form a *jue*, then interspersed and sewn together. When the strips are continuous, ten segments form ten *jue*. They are affixed to the tops of poles and called banners. *Fan* (banners) derive their name from "turning," turning misfortune into fortune. Holding standards ensures that punishments are measured, and no excessive penalties are meted out. Grasping banners enables repentance and cultivation of the Dao, transforming evil into good. The standards and banners erected by the Great Sages enlighten the foolish and deluded. Perfected Ones hold the banners, while Jade Maidens grasp the standards. The rank and status of these insignia follow the regulations, with distinctions in height. For instance, Perfected Ones of the Highest Clarity erect purple-feathered standards, while other ranks are detailed in the ritual codes—this will not be elaborated here.

Ahead, nine phoenixes whistle in unison; behind, eight *luan*-birds sing in harmony.

Dong says: Males are called phoenixes, females *luan*-birds; crimson and five-colored ones are *luan*-birds. Nine divisions of phoenixes lead the way, while eight divisions of *luan*-birds follow. At the first whistle of the dawn, nine phoenixes sing in unison. When the Western Numinous Perfected Ones play the nine-phoenix flutes, the eight *luan*-birds harmonize in response.

Youxī says: Ahead, whistling and singing are met with phoenixes joining in unison; behind, the playing of flutes and pipes is answered by eight *luan*-birds singing in harmony.

Xuan Ying says: The front division belongs to *yang*, and *yang* numbers are odd, hence nine. The rear division belongs to *yin*, and *yin* numbers are even, hence eight.

Lions and white cranes whistle and sing in harmonious resonance.

Dong says: *Yongyong* describes harmonious singing. Phoenixes sing and *luan*-birds call, with all sounds arising together.

Youxī says: Lions roar like tigers, and white cranes sing like phoenixes. Their harmonious resonance blends two sounds in perfect accord.

Shaowei says: This is the music of Heavenly Harmony. The front division whistles and sings, and nine phoenixes join in unison; the rear division plays flowing melodies, and eight *luan*-birds sing in harmony. The *Scripture of Cavernous Divinity* states: "In the left palace of Heavenly Unity, there are instruments of Heavenly Harmony. On the *zi* day, Jade Maidens play the *sheng* and *yu*; on the *chou* day, Jade Maidens whistle and sing; on the *yin* day, Jade Maidens play the *se*; on the *mao* day, Jade Maidens strike the *zhu*; on the *chen* day, Jade Maidens play the *qin*; on the *si* day, Jade Maidens ring bells and strike chimes; on the *wu* day, Jade Maidens play the flute; on the *wei* day, Jade Maidens play the *jia*; on the *shen* day, Jade Maidens sing the nine-tone songs; on the *you* day, Jade Maidens perform the six-variation songs; on the *xu* day, Jade Maidens imitate the cries of a hundred beasts; on the *hai* day, Jade Maidens compose new celestial melodies." Heavenly Harmony is the name of a musical instrument. Its name is the same as those in the world, but its sound differs from the vulgar. Worldly music is mournful and hastens life, while celestial music is harmonious and prolongs life.

Xuan Ying says: This describes lions and white cranes following the procession. When celestial music begins, a hundred beasts dance in unison, hence their voices join in harmonious song.

The Five Elders clear the path, and hosts of immortals flank the shafts.

Dong says: The Five Elders are the Five Emperors. *Qi* means "to open," and *tu* means "path." *Yi* means "to attend," and *yuan* refers to the carriage shafts. When the boundless Flying Heavenly Divine Kings of the Ten Directions arrive at the Azure Beginning Heaven, the Five Emperors clear the path, and hosts of immortals attend and guide them.

Youxī says: The Five Elders clear the path ahead, while hosts of immortals attend to the shafts on either side. The Five Elders are the Five Elderly Emperor Lords, who preside over the Five Chapters of the Perfected Writ.

Shaowei says: The Five Elders are the Five Emperors. The exalted positions of the Great Sages of the Ten Directions move the Five Emperors to lead the way, with hosts of immortals harnessing the five talismans. The *Scripture of Fundamental Conduct* states: "In the east, the Azure Numinous Beginning Elder of the Treasure-Fragrant Flower Forest is called the Azure Emperor. His surname is *He*, his taboo name is *Kai*, and his style is *Lingwei Yang*. He favors the color azure, rides a Dark Dragon, raises a green banner, and is accompanied by a retinue of ninety myriad spirits. He harmonizes the spring *qi* and generates the myriad things."

chunks.original_text: 南方梵宝昌阳丹灵真老号曰赤帝，姓洞浮，讳极炎，字赤熛弩，服色尚赤，驾赤龙，建朱旗，从群神三十万人，和夏气、长万物。 中央玉宝元灵元老号曰黄帝，姓通班，讳元氏，字含枢纽。 服色尚黄，驾黄龙，建黄旗，从群神十二万人，和土气、上载九天。 西方七宝金门皓灵皇老号曰白帝，姓上金，讳昌开，字耀魄宝，服色尚白，驾白龙，建素旗，从群神七十万人，和秋气 ，成万物。 北方洞阴朔单郁绝五灵玄老，号曰黑帝，姓黑节，讳灵会，字隐侯局，服色尚黑，驾黑龙，建玄旗，从群神五十万人，和冬气，藏万物。 五老帝君皆天真自然之神，故曰元始。 五老非后学而成，真者自受符命，各治一方，大劫交周，其位仍易也。 亿乘万骑，浮空而来。 东曰：万万曰亿也。 乘凤车也，骑龙麟也，飞仙并乘龙驾无鞅之众，凤车羽盖浮空而到也。 ○幽栖曰：亿乘万骑，明其多也。 浮空而来，非履地也。 倾光回驾，监真度生。 东曰：倾，盖也。 光，日也。 度生，真人也，字扶羲，常主教九幽之录，善恶之因。 善者则受其开度，恶者则极其对根。 尔时十方大圣，盖天而来，下障翳日光，回驾於诸天之境，倾光於上帝之前，监诸修诵成真之至士，度祖考应生之魂魄者也。 ○玄英曰：倾，动也。 光者，车舆章服辉耀也。 回驾者，众圣临轩，既受天尊符命讫，遂乃倾动光仪，回其车驾，各归本国，监领群真，度脱得仙之人，故云监真度生也。 诸天丞相，南昌上宫。 东日：丞相，大罗天之神公也。 上宫，朱陵宫也。 丞相为受度更生之宾，定命籍於朱宫，削罪根於三官也。 ○幽栖曰：九宫有上相二真之位，辅弼诸天之事，故居於南昌上宫，即九宫之南，赤明和阳天中者也。 韩司主录， 东曰：韩司，司命也。

In the south, the Vermilion Numinous True Elder of the Brahma-Treasure Flourishing Yang is called the Vermilion Emperor. His surname is *Dongfu*, his taboo name is *Jiyan*, and his style is *Chibiao Nu*. He favors the color vermilion, rides a Red Dragon, raises a crimson banner, and is accompanied by a retinue of thirty myriad spirits. He harmonizes the summer *qi* and nurtures the myriad things.

At the center, the Jade-Treasure Primordial Numinous Elder is called the Yellow Emperor. His surname is *Tongban*, his taboo name is *Yuanshi*, and his style is *Han Shuniu*. He favors the color yellow, rides a Yellow Dragon, raises a yellow banner, and is accompanied by a retinue of twelve myriad spirits. He harmonizes the *qi* of earth and upholds the Nine Heavens.

In the west, the August Numinous Elder of the Seven-Treasure Golden Gate is called the White Emperor. His surname is *Shangjin*, his taboo name is *Changkai*, and his style is *Yaopo Bao*. He favors the color white, rides a White Dragon, raises a plain banner, and is accompanied by a retinue of seventy myriad spirits. He harmonizes the autumn *qi* and ripens the myriad things.

In the north, the Mysterious Elder of the Profound Yin, Solitary Darkness, and Five Numinosities is called the Black Emperor. His surname is *Heijie*, his taboo name is *Linghui*, and his style is *Yin Houju*. He favors the color black, rides a Black Dragon, raises a dark banner, and is accompanied by a retinue of fifty myriad spirits. He harmonizes the winter *qi* and stores the myriad things.

The Five Elderly Emperor Lords are all celestial perfected spirits of spontaneous origin, hence called the Primordial Beginning. The Five Elders are not formed through later study; the perfected receive their mandates directly, each governing one direction. When great kalpas complete their cycles, their positions still shift.

A hundred million chariots and ten thousand riders arrive floating through the void. The East says: "A hundred million is ten thousand myriad." The chariots are phoenix carriages, the riders are dragon-unicorns. Flying immortals together ride dragon-drawn hosts without number, their phoenix carriages and feathered canopies floating through the void to arrive.

The Recluse says: "A hundred million chariots and ten thousand riders—this clarifies their multitude. Floating through the void, they do not tread upon the earth."

Their radiance tilts, their chariots turn back, overseeing the perfected and delivering the living. The East says: "Tilting is like a canopy. Radiance is the sun. Delivering the living refers to the perfected one, whose style is *Fu Xi*, who constantly oversees the registers of the Nine Dark Regions and the causes of good and evil. Those who are good receive his deliverance; those who are evil face the roots of their transgressions."

At that time, the Great Sages of the Ten Directions tilt the heavens to come, descending to shield the sun’s brilliance. They turn their chariots back to the realms of the various heavens, tilting their radiance before the Supreme Emperor, overseeing those adepts who have cultivated and recited to attain perfection, and delivering the souls of ancestors who are due to be reborn.

The Mysterious Splendor says: "Tilting means moving. Radiance refers to the splendor of chariots, carriages, and vestments. Turning back the chariots means that once the hosts of sages have received the Heavenly Worthy’s mandate, they then tilt their luminous regalia, turn their chariots, and each returns to their own realm, overseeing the hosts of perfected and delivering those who have attained immortality. Thus it is called overseeing the perfected and delivering the living."

The Prime Ministers of the Various Heavens reside in the Southern Prosperity Upper Palace. The East says: "The Prime Ministers are the divine lords of the Great Luo Heaven. The Upper Palace is the Vermilion Numinous Palace. The Prime Ministers serve as guests for those who receive deliverance and rebirth, determining their destinies in the Vermilion Palace and excising the roots of their transgressions in the Three Bureaus."

The Recluse says: "The Nine Palaces have the positions of the Two Perfected Upper Ministers, who assist in the affairs of the various heavens. Thus they reside in the Southern Prosperity Upper Palace, which is the south of the Nine Palaces, within the Heaven of Crimson Clarity and Harmonious Yang."

Han presides over the registers. The East says: "Han is the Controller of Destiny."

chunks.original_text: 应得度者，司命即执主录算度於南宫，而得受炼度者也。 监生大神。 东曰：监生大神主领长夜之宫，校学道簿录，度九幽之魂。 大神者，十方飞天神王也。 常在飞玄之上，而诵洞玄之经，以自然之炁，拔度学道之人也。 ○幽栖曰：韩司，即前韩君之司也。 主录，即主监长生之录，故云监生大神也。 执录把籍，齐到帝前。 东曰：十方大神，各领司录执持录籍以到玉帝之前。 玉帝讳廓奕，治玉京玄台之中，与元始同生，为玄元之范，开灭度之门，教学仙之人也。 ○幽栖曰：十方至真，与诸天丞相及监生大神并抱执算度之录籍，俱会帝前以迁举也。 ○少微曰：韩司主录门下司录也，主人录籍，故曰主录。 监生大神，更生真人也。 字扶羲，领长夜之府，度九幽之魂。 是时诸天帝主各领丞相，齐到陛下校度死生。 帝者，天尊自谓也。 天尊一号玉帝。 按《龙蹻经》元始有十号：一曰自然，二曰无极，三曰大道，四曰至真，五曰太上，六曰老君，七曰高皇，八曰天尊，九曰玉帝，十曰陛下。 随所应度，严校诸天。 东曰：学士若能明八字之音，则神公开长明之户，十方幽魂并得度入更生之门，上登玉京之台，欢乐紫极之宫。 中有神婴之童，一歌无量之章，立得反形於三炼之房，身受自然之炁，欢乐无极之龄。 ○幽栖曰：随所在修诵之人应合得度者，校勘诸天之名簿籍，句会功满之录也。 ○少微曰：皆随功轻重，应事开度，严校诸天，罔有遗失。 普告三界，无极神乡。 东曰：三界者，欲界、色界、无色界也。 无极者，十方无极世界也。 普告十方，无极无穷之神，普令知闻也。 ○幽栖曰：告勑三界、五帝之魔王，逮及无极无穷之神域，有司必告无幽不闻也。 ○少微曰：玉帝告也； 三界者，欲界六天，色界十八天，无色界四天，诸神之乡无有限极，故曰无极神乡。 泉曲之府，北都罗酆。 东曰：北都，玉都也。
chunks.translated_text:
Those who are destined for deliverance—it is the Controller of Destiny who, holding the register of life-calculations, conducts their refinement and deliverance in the Southern Palace, thereby enabling them to undergo the alchemical refinement and attain deliverance.

The Great Divine Overseer of Birth.
The East says: "The Great Divine Overseer of Birth presides over the Palace of the Endless Night, examining the ledgers of Dao-cultivators and delivering the souls of the Nine Dark Realms. The Great Divine Ones are the Flying Heavenly Divine Kings of the Ten Directions. They ever abide above the Flying Mystery, reciting the scriptures of the Cavernous Mystery, and by means of the spontaneous qi, they rescue and deliver those who cultivate the Dao."

The Recluse says: "The Han Controller is the same as the Controller of the former Han Lord. The 'Main Register' refers to the register that oversees and monitors longevity, hence it is called the Great Divine Overseer of Birth. Holding the registers and grasping the ledgers, they assemble together before the Emperor."

The East says: "The Great Divine Ones of the Ten Directions each oversee their respective registers, holding the ledgers as they present themselves before the Jade Emperor. The Jade Emperor’s tabooed name is Kuoyi, and he governs within the Mysterious Terrace of the Jade Capital. Born together with the Primordial Beginning, he is the model of the Mysterious Origin, opening the gate of extinction and deliverance to teach those who study immortality."

The Recluse says: "The Perfected Ones of the Ten Directions, together with the Prime Ministers of the Various Heavens and the Great Divine Overseer of Birth, all carry the registers of deliverance calculations and assemble before the Emperor to promote and elevate the worthy."

The Lesser Mystery says: "The Han Controller is the registrar under the Main Register Office, responsible for the ledgers of human destinies, hence called the Main Register. The Great Divine Overseer of Birth is the Perfected One of Rebirth, named Fu Xi, who presides over the Palace of the Endless Night and delivers the souls of the Nine Dark Realms. At that time, the lords of the various heavens, each leading their prime ministers, assemble before Your Majesty to examine and assess life and death."

The Emperor is the Heavenly Worthy speaking of himself. One of the Heavenly Worthy’s titles is Jade Emperor. According to the *Scripture of the Dragon’s Ascent*, the Primordial Beginning has ten titles: the Spontaneous, the Boundless, the Great Dao, the Utmost Perfected, the Supreme, the Venerable Lord, the August Sovereign, the Heavenly Worthy, the Jade Emperor, and the August Thearch. As each is to be delivered, the heavens are strictly examined.

The East says: "If a scholar can clearly enunciate the eight-character incantation, then the Divine Lords will open the Gate of Eternal Light, and the souls of the Ten Directions will all attain deliverance, entering the Gate of Rebirth. Ascending to the Terrace of the Jade Capital, they will rejoice in the Purple Ultimate Palace. Within it, the Divine Infant sings the hymn of the Immeasurable, and immediately they regain their forms in the Chamber of Triple Refinement, their bodies receiving the spontaneous qi, rejoicing in boundless longevity."

The Recluse says: "Wherever there are those who recite and cultivate, those who are destined for deliverance are assessed according to the ledgers of the various heavens, their merits tallied and their records complete."

The Lesser Mystery says: "All are delivered according to the weight of their merits and the circumstances of their karmic conditions. The heavens are strictly examined, with nothing omitted or lost. A universal proclamation is made to the Three Realms and the Boundless Divine Regions."

The East says: "The Three Realms are the Realm of Desire, the Realm of Form, and the Formless Realm. The Boundless refers to the boundless worlds of the Ten Directions. A universal proclamation is made to the gods of the Ten Directions, the boundless and infinite, so that all may know and hear."

The Recluse says: "A decree is issued to the demon kings of the Three Realms and the Five Emperors, extending even to the boundless and infinite divine domains, ensuring that no hidden place remains uninformed."

The Lesser Mystery says: "This is the Jade Emperor’s proclamation. The Three Realms consist of the six heavens of the Realm of Desire, the eighteen heavens of the Realm of Form, and the four heavens of the Formless Realm. The divine regions are without limit, hence called the Boundless Divine Regions. The Subterranean Palace of the Yellow Springs and the Northern Capital of Fengdu."

The East says: "The Northern Capital is the Jade Capital."

chunks.original_text: 罗酆，山名也。 罗酆之山在天地之北，北海之外，山高二千六百里，内外皆七宝宫室，天地鬼神之所处，三界六天、北帝大魔王治乎其中。 凡六宫皆六天鬼神之治，洞中有六宫，亦相像如一。 下元三品水官结风泽之炁，凝晨浩之精，置下元三官。 第一名汤谷洞泉宫，一号清华方诸宫； 总主水帝汤谷神王、九江水府、河伯、神仙、诸真人、水中诸大神已得道、过去及未得道有功之魂，受度而升。 其宫置左、右、中三府，左号青元灵渊府，右号九冰寒夜府，中号朔单青灵府。 簿录并封九河洞室。 其下元左宫名清泠宫，一号南水会宫，总主水中万精、蛟龙、鲸鲵，入会水母龙门各五亿，万重风泽金刚之炁。 其宫置左、右、中三府，中号灵宝劫刃府，左号龄劫府，右号长夜寒庭府，主水中万灵。 下元右宫名北酆都宫，一名罗酆宫，总主水中积夜死魂谪役之劫； 其左府号开度劫量府，右府号泉曲鬼神府，中府号通灵大劫府。 下元三品，水官三宫，宫统一十四曹，三宫合四十二曹，并治九江洞室，皆自然之号，并统三河四海九江水府一切神灵、已得道及未得道并地上五岳真仙、玉女。 常以太岁甲子庚申之日，下诣汤谷、清泠、北酆都三官，校集九府生死簿录。 昔天地改运，沦於延康，冥冥无开，飞天启光，於是散晖诸天，受炁洒灵，玄都故云玉都，亦大圣之号。 北帝上真治乎玄灵之宫，下有寒冰夜庭，又有八难之场，故曰泉曲府也。 ○幽栖曰：泉曲府即九幽长夜之鬼府，北都罗酆即酆都，北帝之鬼都。 罗酆是北海九幽之山，名鬼都，即在罗酆幽山之上者也。 ○少微曰：此下元右宫也。 按《真诰》云北酆在天地之北外癸地，一名酆都泉曲府，酆都右府也。 罗酆是北都上山名也，高二千六百里，周回三万里，下有洞天，周回万五千里。 内外皆有七宝宫室，有上、中、下三官，各八狱，合二十四狱，皆天地鬼神所处也。 三官九署，十二河源。 东曰：三官者，天、地、水三官也。 上元天官，有三官。 官统一十二曹，合三十六曹。 中元地官，亦有三官，·官统一十四曹，合四十二曹。 下元水官，亦有三宫，官统一十四曹，合四十二曹。 三官都合一百二十曹，主领鬼、神、人。 天、地、水三官，合为九署。 及九海、三河、十二川源之中生死图籍，无渊无底，无极神仙、一切神灵，普皆宣告也。 ○幽栖曰：三官即酆都三官。 酆都有六宫，二宫立一官，六宫故立三官也。 一官有三署，三官有九署。 左为火官，右为水官，中为女官，并随事源，主司考掠，如世上之六曹。 十二河源即水府也。 事与三官九署相符。 三官九署亦十二也，且属北方，与北俱是阴位，故取二六之数，以置十二官也。 此亦举主宰耳，其余小位，不复言也。 ○少微曰：三官者，上元天官，中元地官，下元水官。 主九署，九府署司也。 十二河源者，月为太阴之精，诸水之母。 井，是天河之源，众水之泉。 一月一周天，一年十二月，每月皆过於东井，沃黄水之华，濯天人之容。 若先祖未生，皆蒙炼度，以成仙真。 事见《三五顺行经》。

Fengdu is the name of a mountain. The Mountain of Fengdu lies north of Heaven and Earth, beyond the Northern Sea. Its height is two thousand six hundred li, and both its interior and exterior are adorned with palaces of the seven treasures, where the gods and spirits of Heaven and Earth reside. Within it, the Six Heavens of the Three Realms and the Great Demon King of the Northern Emperor hold dominion. Each of the six palaces governs the ghosts and spirits of the Six Heavens, and within the cavern are six palaces, all mirroring one another.

The Three Lesser Water Officials of the Lower Prime condense the qi of wind and marsh, coagulating the essence of the vast and luminous, establishing the Three Offices of the Lower Prime. The first is named the Tanggu Cavern Spring Palace, also called the Qinghua Fangzhu Palace. It governs the Water Emperor, the Divine King of Tanggu, the Nine River Water Courts, the River Earls, the immortals, the perfected ones, and all the great spirits within the waters who have attained the Dao, as well as the souls of the past and those who, though yet to attain the Dao, have accrued merit, receiving deliverance and ascension. This palace comprises three bureaus: left, right, and central. The left is named the Azure Origin Numinous Abyss Bureau; the right, the Ninefold Ice Cold Night Bureau; and the central, the Solitary North Azure Numinous Bureau. They register and seal the caverns of the Nine Rivers.

The Lower Prime’s left palace is named the Qingling Palace, also called the Southern Water Assembly Palace. It governs the myriad spirits within the waters—jiao dragons, whales, and leviathans—with five hundred million each of the Water Mother and Dragon Gate, all enveloped in the qi of ten thousand layers of wind-marsh vajra. This palace also comprises three bureaus: the central is named the Numinous Treasure Kalpa Blade Bureau; the left, the Ling Kalpa Bureau; and the right, the Long Night Cold Court Bureau, which oversees the myriad spirits of the waters.

The Lower Prime’s right palace is named the Northern Fengdu Palace, also called the Fengdu Palace. It governs the accumulated souls of the dead in eternal night, condemned to penal servitude. Its left bureau is named the Liberation and Kalpa Measure Bureau; the right, the Spring Cavern Ghosts and Spirits Bureau; and the central, the Numinous Passage Great Kalpa Bureau.

The Three Lesser Water Officials of the Lower Prime oversee three palaces, each governing fourteen departments, totaling forty-two departments across the three palaces. Together, they administer the caverns of the Nine Rivers, all bearing natural designations, and command all the spirits of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine River Water Courts—both those who have attained the Dao and those who have not—as well as the perfected immortals and jade maidens of the Five Sacred Peaks upon the earth. On the days of *gengshen* in the sexagenary cycle of the Great Year, they descend to the Three Offices of Tanggu, Qingling, and Northern Fengdu to review and compile the registers of life and death of the Nine Bureaus.

In ancient times, when Heaven and Earth underwent transformation and sank into the era of Yankang, all was dark and unopened until the Flying Celestials illuminated the light. Thereupon, they scattered radiance across the heavens, receiving qi and sprinkling numinosity. The former name of the Mysterious Capital was the Jade Capital, also a title of the Great Sage. The Supreme Perfected of the Northern Emperor governs the Palace of Mysterious Numinosity, beneath which lies the Cold Ice Night Court, and further below, the realm of the Eight Difficulties. Thus, it is called the Spring Cavern Palace.

The Recluse says: "The Spring Cavern Palace is the ghostly court of the Ninefold Dark and Eternal Night, while the Northern Capital of Fengdu is Fengdu, the ghostly capital of the Northern Emperor. Fengdu is the mountain of the Ninefold Dark in the Northern Sea, named the Ghost Capital, situated atop the dark mountain of Fengdu."

The Lesser Mystery says: "This is the right palace of the Lower Prime. According to the *True Instructions*, the Northern Fengdu lies in the outer *gui* region north of Heaven and Earth, also named the Fengdu Spring Cavern Palace, the right bureau of Fengdu. Fengdu is the name of the mountain in the Northern Capital, towering two thousand six hundred li in height, with a circumference of thirty thousand li. Beneath it lies a cavern-heaven with a circumference of fifteen thousand li. Both its interior and exterior are adorned with palaces of the seven treasures. There are the Upper, Middle, and Lower Offices, each with eight prisons, totaling twenty-four prisons, all dwelling places of the gods and spirits of Heaven and Earth. The Three Offices and Nine Bureaus correspond to the Twelve River Sources."

The East says: "The Three Offices are the Offices of Heaven, Earth, and Water. The Upper Prime’s Celestial Office comprises three offices, each governing twelve departments, totaling thirty-six departments. The Middle Prime’s Terrestrial Office also comprises three offices, each governing fourteen departments, totaling forty-two departments. The Lower Prime’s Water Office likewise comprises three palaces, each governing fourteen departments, totaling forty-two departments. Together, the Three Offices comprise one hundred twenty departments, overseeing ghosts, spirits, and humans. The Offices of Heaven, Earth, and Water form the Nine Bureaus. Within the Nine Seas, Three Rivers, and Twelve River Sources, the registers of life and death are boundless and fathomless. All the infinite immortals and spirits are universally proclaimed."

The Recluse says: "The Three Offices are the Three Offices of Fengdu. Fengdu has six palaces, with two palaces constituting one office, hence six palaces form three offices. Each office has three bureaus, so three offices have nine bureaus. The left is the Fire Office, the right the Water Office, and the central the Female Office, each following the source of affairs, overseeing examinations and punishments, akin to the Six Ministries of the mundane world. The Twelve River Sources are the Water Courts, their affairs corresponding to the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus. The Three Offices and Nine Bureaus also number twelve, and since they belong to the north, which is a yin position, the number twelve is adopted to establish the twelve offices. This merely designates the principal authorities; lesser positions are not mentioned."

The Lesser Mystery says: "The Three Offices are the Upper Prime’s Celestial Office, the Middle Prime’s Terrestrial Office, and the Lower Prime’s Water Office. They govern the Nine Bureaus, the administrative bureaus of the Nine Courts. The Twelve River Sources refer to the moon as the essence of the Great Yin and the mother of all waters. The Well is the source of the Celestial River and the fountainhead of all waters. Each month, the moon completes a circuit of the heavens, and each year, twelve months pass, with the moon traversing the Eastern Well each month, irrigating the blossoms of the Yellow Waters and bathing the countenances

chunks.original_text: 按《三元品戒经》说上元天官隶玉清境，结青、黄、白三炁，置上元三官。 玄炁为中宫，始炁为左宫，元炁为右宫，其中宫名元阳七宝紫微宫，结青元始阳之炁，总主上真自然玉虚高皇上帝、诸天帝王、上圣大神。 其官皆五亿五万五千五百五十五亿万重，其中神仙官寮亦有五亿五万五千五百五十五亿万众，皆结自然青元之炁而为人也。 衣则青羽飞衣。 紫微宫中有延生之符，出符以置八方，则八方之炁效然响应，皆即成人，藏符则复化为炁。 宫置左右中三府，左府主生官，太阳火官考； 右府主死官，太阴水官考； 中府主生死，罪福风刀之考。 考者，核实其事，大福三年考，中福九年考，小福二十四年考。 三府各领官寮九千万众，总统生死罪福一十二曹。 其左宫名太玄都元黄太极左宫，即玉清左相宫也。 结元黄之炁而成，总主千真已得道及男女生命箓籍，宫数、官寮不异中宫，亦结自然元黄之炁而为人，衣则黄羽飞衣。 太极左宫有招灵之符，用之亦如延生符也。 左宫亦置三府，主考罪福，一同中宫也。 右宫亦名太玄都洞白太极，右宫是清微宫也。 结天元洞白之炁而成，总主上真已得道、未得道百姓男女仙录罪籍，宫数、官寮亦不异中宫。 其人亦结自然洞白之炁而成，衣则白羽飞衣。 宫中有明真之符，用之亦同延生招灵也。 左右中三府主考罪福，一同中宫。 上元三宫，宫统三府，府统四曹，九府共三十六曹，并治元阳之上，太空之中有功德满足、应合仙者，言名紫微宫； 有敬信宗奉大法者，言名太极左宫； 应死者，言名右宫。 中元二品地官者，隶上清境，结元洞混灵之炁，凝极黄之精而成。 其中宫名洞灵清虚宫，总主五帝五岳诸真人、及诸地神仙已得道者。 其宫皆五亿五万五千五百五十五亿万重，其中神仙官寮有九万九千九百九十九万众，此皆死者有功德之魂，非自然之炁也。 受度得神仙地官之任，各有年限，功满德进，升为天府仙官； 功未满者，还生人中。 中宫置左、右、中三府，左号耐犯明晨府，右号纣绝阴天府，中号七非恬照府。 主考罪福、阴阳、年数，不异上元也。 左宫名南极洞阳宫，主地上九土土皇、八极诸灵官及生命录籍，宫数官寮不异清虚宫也。 宫置三府，左号连宛曲泉府，右号大煞九幽府，中号罪气咸池府，主考罪福，年数不异左宫。 中元三宫三府，共统一十四曹，九府合四十二曹，并治山洞空中，言奏善恶，不异上元也。 下元三品水官，隶太清境，结风泽之炁，凝晨浩之精而成。 其中宫号汤谷洞泉宫，一曰青华方诸宫，总主水帝汤谷神王、九江水府、河伯神仙、水中诸大神及仙箓簿籍，宫数官寮与中元同也。 官寮亦是有功德之魂补之。 宫置三府，左府号青元灵泉府，右号九泉寒夜府，中号朔单青灵府，主考年限罪福，不异中元。 左宫名清灵宫，生水中万精、鲛龙鲸鲵，又会水母龙门，度数之期，及人命箓籍生死功过，炁是风泽金刚之炁，官寮宫数不异中宫。 右宫置三府，左号灵劫府，右号长夜府，中号灵宝劫刃府，主考罪福，亦如中宫也。 总主水中精魂百鬼万灵，无是风泽梵行之炁，宫数官寮亦同中元也。 右名酆都宫，置三府，左号开度劫量府，中号通灵大劫府，右号泉曲鬼神府，主考罪福，亦同中元也。
chunks.translated_text:
According to the *Scripture of the Three Primes’ Precepts and Commandments*, the Upper Prime’s Celestial Office is subordinate to the Jade Clarity Realm, where the qi of blue, yellow, and white coalesce to establish the Three Offices of the Upper Prime. The Mysterious Qi forms the Central Palace; the Primordial Qi, the Left Palace; and the Original Qi, the Right Palace. The Central Palace is named the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Seven Treasures of Primordial Yang, where the qi of the Blue Primordial and Primal Yang coalesce. It presides over the Supreme Thearch of the Jade Void of the Upper Realized Ones, the Thearchs of the Myriad Heavens, and the Great Spirits of the Upper Sages. Its offices number fifty-five myriad, five thousand five hundred fifty-five myriad myriad layers, and among its divine and immortal officials, there are likewise fifty-five myriad, five thousand five hundred fifty-five myriad myriad beings, all coalesced from the natural Blue Primordial Qi to form humans. Their robes are feathered flying garments of blue. Within the Purple Tenuity Palace resides the Talisman of Prolonged Life; when this talisman is issued to the eight directions, the qi of the eight directions responds with immediate resonance, and all instantly become human. When the talisman is concealed, they revert to qi. The palace establishes three bureaus—left, right, and central. The Left Bureau governs the Office of Life, overseen by the Fire Official of Grand Yang; the Right Bureau governs the Office of Death, overseen by the Water Official of Grand Yin; and the Central Bureau governs both life and death, examining transgressions and blessings with the Wind Blade. The term "examine" means to verify matters: great blessings are reviewed every three years, middling blessings every nine years, and minor blessings every twenty-four years. Each of the three bureaus commands ninety million officials, collectively overseeing the twelve departments of life, death, transgressions, and blessings.

The Left Palace is named the Palace of the Great Mysterious Primordial Yellow and Supreme Ultimate of the Left, also known as the Left Ministerial Palace of Jade Clarity. It coalesces from the Primordial Yellow Qi and presides over the thousand perfected ones who have attained the Dao, as well as the registers of male and female lives. Its palace numbers and officials do not differ from the Central Palace; they, too, coalesce from the natural Primordial Yellow Qi to form humans, and their robes are feathered flying garments of yellow. Within the Supreme Ultimate Palace of the Left resides the Talisman of Summoning Spirits, used in the same manner as the Talisman of Prolonged Life. The Left Palace also establishes three bureaus, which examine transgressions and blessings in the same manner as the Central Palace.

The Right Palace is also named the Palace of the Great Mysterious Cavern White and Supreme Ultimate of the Right, which is the Palace of Pure Tenuity. It coalesces from the Cavern White Qi of the Celestial Primordial and presides over the Upper Realized Ones who have attained the Dao, as well as the registers of the common people—both male and female—who have not yet attained the Dao, along with their records of transgressions. Its palace numbers and officials likewise do not differ from the Central Palace. Its inhabitants coalesce from the natural Cavern White Qi to form humans, and their robes are feathered flying garments of white. Within the palace resides the Talisman of Illuminating the Realized, used in the same manner as the Talismans of Prolonged Life and Summoning Spirits. The three bureaus—left, right, and central—examine transgressions and blessings in the same manner as the Central Palace.

The Three Palaces of the Upper Prime each govern three bureaus, and each bureau governs four departments, so that the nine bureaus collectively oversee thirty-six departments. Those who have accumulated sufficient merit and virtue and are destined for immortality are recorded in the Purple Tenuity Palace; those who revere and uphold the Great Dao are recorded in the Supreme Ultimate Palace of the Left; and those destined for death are recorded in the Right Palace.

The Terrestrial Office of the Middle Prime’s second rank is subordinate to the Supreme Clarity Realm, coalescing from the Cavernous Mixed Spirit Qi and condensing the essence of the Ultimate Yellow. Its Central Palace is named the Palace of Cavernous Spirit and Pure Tenuity, presiding over the Five Thearchs, the Five Marchmounts, and all the perfected terrestrial immortals who have attained the Dao. Its palaces number fifty-five myriad, five thousand five hundred fifty-five myriad myriad layers, and among its divine and immortal officials, there are ninety-nine myriad, nine thousand nine hundred ninety-nine myriad beings. These are the souls of the deceased who possessed merit and virtue, not coalesced from natural qi. Having received deliverance, they assume the duties of the Terrestrial Office of Immortals, each with a fixed term. When their merit is complete and their virtue advanced, they ascend to become officials of the Celestial Bureaus; those whose merit is incomplete return to be reborn among humans.

The Central Palace establishes three bureaus—left, right, and central. The Left Bureau is named the Bureau of Enduring Transgressions and Bright Dawn; the Right Bureau, the Bureau of Yin’s Termination and Heaven’s Severance; and the Central Bureau, the Bureau of the Seven Wrongs and Tranquil Illumination. They examine transgressions, blessings, yin and yang, and the reckoning of years in the same manner as the Upper Prime. The Left Palace is named the Palace of the Southern Culmen and Cavernous Yang, presiding over the Nine Earths’ Earthly Thearchs, the myriad spirit officials of the Eight Poles, and the registers of lives. Its palace numbers and officials do not differ from the Palace of Pure Tenuity. The palace establishes three bureaus: the Left Bureau is named the Bureau of the Winding Dark Springs; the Right Bureau, the Bureau of the Great Execution of the Nine Netherworlds; and the Central Bureau, the Bureau of the Punitive Qi of the Salty Pond. They examine transgressions and blessings, and the reckoning of years does not differ from the Left Palace. The three palaces and three bureaus of the Middle Prime collectively oversee fourteen departments, and the nine bureaus together govern forty-two departments. They all reside within the caverns of mountains, where they memorialize good and evil in the same manner as the Upper Prime.

The Water Office of the Lower Prime’s third rank is subordinate to the Grand Clarity Realm, coalescing from the qi of wind and marsh and condensing the essence of the Vast Dawn. Its Central Palace is named the Palace of the Scalding Valley and Cavernous Springs, also called the Palace of Azure Florescence and the Square Cauldron. chunks.original_text: 下元三宫，宫统三府； 九府合四十二曹，三府共一十四曹，并治九室，总统八海四渎水帝神王、水中一切灵祇。 三元总九官二十七府、百二十曹。 左主生事，右主死事，有功书左府青簿，有罪书右府黑簿，若罪中涉福，福中涉罪，则不专一曹也。 得道奉中宫，有功奏左宫，有罪奏右宫，每到三元八节日，绝灭恶根也。 ○玄英曰：此明黄水月华炼度死魂之事。 十二者，年中十二月也。 河源者，河即天河也。 天有二十八宿，东井星是天河之源，众水之泉，月为太阴之精，诸水之母。 月行则每月一周天，皆经东井，吐水灌注，故云十二河源。 若死魂受生，皆蒙黄水炼度，以成真仙，此文开度死魂，故举十二河源以明其事，且三元八节、劝在修行，学者若得轻升，亦能超度先祖，谓下文。 上解祖考，亿劫种亲。 幽栖曰：解脱累代祖考之幽魂，原宥亿劫之宗亲也。 ○少微曰：每三官校录，因子孙有大功，玉帝即为上解，亿劫祖考、一切种亲，度生诸天也。 疾除罪簿，落灭恶根。 东曰：疾，速也。 簿，录也。 速除罪录，绝灭恶根也。 ○幽栖曰：速除其罪谪之黑簿，急落其恶对之深根者也。 不得拘留，逼合鬼群。 东曰：拘，闭也。 逼，强也。 不得闭系魂爽，强聚鬼庭之中，遏塞正教也。 ○幽栖曰：既赖经功以技度，复沐道恩以解脱，岂更有拘系留滞之艰，混合群鬼之中。 ○少微曰：约勑三官有功德者，不得拘留魂爽，逼合鬼群也。 元始符命，时克升迁，北都寒池，部卫形魂。 东曰：元始天尊说经之时，命召十方无极世界地狱之中、一刻之时幽夜之中、寒冰夜庭三官九府，一时各部领鬼神侍卫，将从得出，长夜之府，并皆开度，得见光明也。 ○幽栖曰：元始降符，勑命昼时，克以升超。 北帝告寒池受形之魂，部领出泉曲之府。 寒池者，刑罚之池也。 ○少微曰：酆都下有寒池，诸鬼神有舒慢者，玉帝即用符命，一时一刻，寒冰夜庭，三官九府各部领幽魂移出长夜之府，并承开度，得见光明。 制魔保举，度品南宫。 东曰：三界魔王常作谣歌以乱学者之心。

The Lower Prime comprises three palaces, each governing three bureaus; the nine bureaus together oversee forty-two departments, with each set of three bureaus jointly administering fourteen departments and nine chambers. They collectively govern the Water Emperors and Divine Kings of the Eight Seas and Four Watercourses, as well as all numinous spirits within the waters. The Three Primes in total comprise nine palaces, twenty-seven bureaus, and one hundred twenty departments.

The Left governs matters of life, the Right governs matters of death. Meritorious deeds are recorded in the green registers of the Left Bureau, while transgressions are inscribed in the black registers of the Right Bureau. If transgressions are intermingled with blessings, or blessings with transgressions, they are not assigned to a single department.

Those who attain the Dao are reported to the Central Palace; those with merit are memorialized to the Left Palace; those with transgressions are memorialized to the Right Palace. On each of the Three Primes and Eight Festivals, the roots of evil are severed.

**Xuan Ying states:** This elucidates the matter of refining and delivering deceased souls with the Yellow Waters and Moon Essence. The "twelve" refers to the twelve months of the year. The "River Source" is the Celestial River. The heavens possess the Twenty-Eight Constellations, and the Well Star of the Eastern Quadrant is the source of the Celestial River, the fountainhead of all waters. The Moon is the essence of the Great Yin and the mother of all waters. As the Moon traverses the heavens each month, it passes through the Well Star, exhaling water to irrigate the earth—hence the term "Twelve River Sources." When deceased souls receive rebirth, they are all refined by the Yellow Waters to become perfected immortals. This passage expounds on the deliverance of deceased souls, thus invoking the Twelve River Sources to clarify the matter. Moreover, the Three Primes and Eight Festivals serve as exhortations for cultivation. Should practitioners attain swift ascent, they may also deliver their ancestors, as referred to in the following text:

*Liberating ancestors and progenitors, kin of kalpas innumerable.*

**Youxi states:** This means freeing the imprisoned souls of ancestral generations and pardoning the karmic bonds of clan relatives across countless kalpas.

**Shaowei states:** Whenever the Three Officials conduct their reviews, if descendants have accrued great merit, the Jade Emperor will immediately grant liberation to their ancestors, progenitors, and all clan relatives across kalpas, delivering them to be reborn in the heavens.

*Swiftly erasing the ledgers of transgression, severing the roots of evil.*

**Dong states:** *Ji* means swift; *bu* means record. To swiftly expunge the records of transgression and sever the roots of evil.

**Youxi states:** To swiftly erase the black ledgers of karmic retribution and promptly uproot the deep-seated causes of malevolent consequences.

*No longer detained, nor forced to mingle with ghostly multitudes.*

**Dong states:** *Ju* means to confine; *bi* means to compel. No longer confined or bound, nor forcibly gathered within the courts of ghosts, obstructing the true teaching.

**Youxi states:** Having relied on the merit of scriptural recitation for deliverance and bathed in the grace of the Dao for liberation, how could there remain any hardship of confinement or stagnation, or mingling among the throngs of ghosts?

**Shaowei states:** By the edict of the Three Officials, those with merit shall not be detained or compelled to mingle with ghostly multitudes.

*By the talismanic command of the Primordial Beginning, they ascend in due time. In the Frigid Pool of the Northern Capital, their forms and souls are marshaled and guarded.*

**Dong states:** When the Primordial Heavenly Worthy expounded the scriptures, He issued a command summoning the officials of the Nine Bureaus from the hells of the ten directions and boundless worlds, from the darkest hour of the night, and from the icy courts of the Northern Capital. In an instant, each marshaled their ghostly legions to escort the delivered souls forth from the Palace of Eternal Night, allowing them all to behold the light.

**Youxi states:** By the talismanic decree of the Primordial Beginning, they ascend in the daylight hours. The Northern Emperor instructs the souls of the Frigid Pool—those who received form—to be marshaled forth from the Bureau of Winding Springs. The Frigid Pool is the pool of punishment.

**Shaowei states:** Beneath Fengdu lies the Frigid Pool. Should any ghost or spirit grow lax, the Jade Emperor issues a talismanic command, and in an instant, the icy courts of the night, the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, each marshal the imprisoned souls to be moved from the Palace of Eternal Night, all receiving deliverance and beholding the light.

*Subduing demons and safeguarding promotion, they are delivered to the Southern Palace by rank.* **Dong states:** The demon kings of the Three Realms constantly compose deceptive songs to disturb the minds of cultivators.

chunks.original_text: 心固者，魔王保举径升黄笳天中，诣金华山，受太一之信，以制大魔之试； 然后得度。 当尔之时？ 符制魔王，使保度南宫也。 ○幽栖曰：既勑北帝出鬼魂於北府，即制魔王度仙品於南宫。 死魂受炼，仙化成人。 东曰：南宫者，长生之宫也。 度命君治在其中，讳吁员，得入南宫之中。 吁员即炼度朽骸，生童即灌其生津，着生契於四极，给自然之羽童。 生童者，日中灵童也。 ○幽栖曰：死魂举度於南宫，则以流火之 膏炼其鬼质，从兹改化，便得仙也。 生身受度，劫劫长存。 东曰：生身者，魂受炼度而还得迁人，值元始开化，身升长生之宫，亿劫长存者也。 随劫轮转，与天齐年。 东曰：轮转不灭，与天地等年也。 ○幽栖曰：若即此生，身便受升度，则与天齐久，与道同存； 劫始劫终，从劫至劫，劫自成败而我独存者。 天地世界一期运终，是名为一劫也。 ○玄英曰：随劫轮转者，劫有大小，若大劫交周，即是天地败壤、劫火起时是也。 小劫是人之生死一期之尽，谓之为劫。 随劫者谓度死魂受炼成人，不能无死，死后托化，更生为人，是随劫也。 劫劫得生人道，故云与天齐年。 永度三徒、五苦八难。 东曰：永，长也。 三徒者，三恶门名也。 第一、名色欲门，一名上尸道，一名天徒界。 第二、名爱欲门，一名中尸道一名人徒界。 第三、名贪欲门，一名下尸道，一名地徒界。 此为三恶门，一名三尸道，一名三徒界，常居人身中，塞人三关之口，断人三命之根，遏人学仙之路，抑人飞腾之魂。 五苦者，一名五道门。 第一名色累苦心门，一曰太山地狱苦道； 第二名爱累苦神门，一曰风刀苦道； 第三名贪累苦形门，一曰提石负山苦道； 第四名华竞苦精门，一名填海作河苦道。 第五名身累苦魂门，一名吞火食炭镬汤苦道。 故经曰：吾所以有大患者，为吾有身，及吾无身，吾有何患！ 此五苦、五道常居人身，系人命根，遏人招真之路，断人修仙之门。 三徒、五苦合为八难，为罪之本。 而不解形於五道之上，灭迹於五苦之下，众累不断，沈沦罪田。 夫学诸上道，当先断诸累，绝灭苦道，真炁自降，神仙自成，克得变形，游行三清，身入长生之府，无复八难之患也。 超凌三界，逍遥上清。 东曰：超，升也。 凌，高也。 飞升南宫，神王即勑羽林监简上生簿，受符而升仙，游行云宫之中，身着结云之衣，径入朱陵之宫，受福於天堂，与飞天合景，飞行云中。 神王，妙成天王也，字育生，总统十方飞天之神。 羽林监，字邈学，知天中之音，三界所称地只，奉迎洞明神鬼，坐知自然，飞行三界，游乎上清也。 ○幽栖曰：既与天齐年，复与道合形，永出三徒之役，长离五苦之谪； 超八难於鬼都，登九天之真域。 三徒者，一曰长夜徒，二曰寒池徒，三曰摙石徒。 五苦者，一曰刀山苦，二曰剑树苦，三日镬汤苦，四日炉炭苦，五日考谪苦。 八难者，三徒、五苦，共为八难也。 ○少微曰：三徒者，三官徒役也。 一曰天官徒役，奔雷走电； 二曰地官徒役，担山负石； 三曰水官徒役，摙汲溟波。 五苦者，登刀山、履剑树、入镬汤、抱铜柱、吞火食炭也。 八难者，八门幽旷之难，道君所问，飞天对之也。 上清之天，天帝玉真，无色之景梵行。

The steadfast of heart—these the demon kings escort directly to ascend within the Yellow Reed Heavens, where they proceed to Golden Flower Mountain to receive the token of the Great One, thereby subduing the trials of the great demons; only then are they delivered. At that moment, talismans restrain the demon kings, commanding them to safeguard the promotion to the Southern Palace.

**Youqi states:** Once the Northern Emperor is commanded to release the ghostly souls from the Northern Bureau, the demon kings are then restrained to promote the immortal ranks to the Southern Palace. The dead souls undergo refinement, and the immortals are transformed into human form.

**Dong states:** The Southern Palace is the Palace of Longevity. The Lord of Deliverance governs within it, named Xu Yuan, who is admitted into the Southern Palace. Xu Yuan refines the decayed bones, while the Vital Youths irrigate them with the essence of life, inscribing the contract of existence upon the Four Poles and bestowing the natural Feathered Youths. The Vital Youths are the numinous youths of the sun’s midst.

**Youqi states:** When the dead souls are promoted within the Southern Palace, their ghostly substance is refined with the unguent of flowing fire, and from this transformation, they attain immortality. The living form receives deliverance, enduring for kalpas without end.

**Dong states:** The living form refers to the soul that, having undergone refinement and deliverance, regains human existence. When the Primordial Beginning initiates transformation, the body ascends to the Palace of Longevity, enduring for countless kalpas. Revolving through kalpas, it shares the age of Heaven.

**Youqi states:** If in this very life one receives ascension and deliverance, one’s years equal those of Heaven, and one’s form merges with the Dao, enduring from the beginning to the end of kalpas, from kalpa to kalpa, while kalpas themselves rise and fall, yet one alone remains. When the world of Heaven and Earth completes one cycle of its destiny, this is called a kalpa.

**Xuanying states:** "Revolving through kalpas" refers to kalpas of varying magnitudes. When a great kalpa reaches its cycle, it is the time when Heaven and Earth decay and the kalpic fire arises. A lesser kalpa marks the completion of one cycle of human birth and death, termed a kalpa. "Revolving through kalpas" means that the dead souls, refined and transformed into human form, cannot escape death; after death, they are reborn as humans, thus revolving through kalpas. Kalpa after kalpa, they are reborn in the human realm, hence it is said they share the age of Heaven. They forever transcend the Three Paths, the Five Sufferings, and the Eight Difficulties.

**Dong states:** "Forever" means eternally. The Three Paths are the names of the three evil gates. The first is the Gate of Sensual Desire, also called the Upper Corpse Path or the Heavenly Path Realm. The second is the Gate of Attachment, also called the Middle Corpse Path or the Human Path Realm. The third is the Gate of Greed, also called the Lower Corpse Path or the Earthly Path Realm. These are the Three Evil Gates, also termed the Three Corpse Paths or the Three Path Realms, which constantly dwell within the human body, blocking the three passes of the body, severing the three roots of life, obstructing the path to immortal learning, and suppressing the soul’s ascent.

The Five Sufferings are also called the Five Path Gates. The first is the Gate of Sensual Affliction, also called the Hell of Mount Tai; the second is the Gate of Attachment’s Affliction, also called the Path of Wind and Blades; the third is the Gate of Greed’s Affliction, also called the Path of Carrying Stones and Mountains; the fourth is the Gate of Vanity’s Affliction, also called the Path of Filling the Sea to Make Rivers; the fifth is the Gate of Bodily Affliction, also called the Path of Swallowing Fire and Eating Coals in Cauldrons of Boiling Water. Thus, the scripture says: "The reason I have great suffering is because I have a body; if I had no body, what suffering would I have?" These Five Sufferings and Five Paths constantly reside within the human body, binding the root of life, obstructing the path to summoning the true, and severing the gate to immortal cultivation. The Three Paths and Five Sufferings together form the Eight Difficulties, the root of transgression. Without dissolving one’s form above the Five Paths and erasing one’s traces beneath the Five Sufferings, the myriad afflictions remain unsevered, and one sinks into the fields of transgression. Those who study the supreme Ways must first sever all afflictions, extinguish the paths of suffering, so that true qi naturally descends, and immortality naturally manifests. Only then can one transform one’s form, wander through the Three Clarities, enter the Palace of Longevity, and be forever free from the Eight Difficulties.

They transcend and rise above the Three Realms, roaming carefree in the Upper Clarity.

**Dong states:** "Transcend" means to ascend; "rise" means to soar high. Upon ascending to the Southern Palace, the Divine King commands the Feathered Forest Inspector to review the Register of the Living, receive the talisman, and ascend as an immortal, roaming amidst the Cloud Palaces, clad in garments woven of clouds, proceeding directly to the Vermilion Mound Palace to receive blessings in the Heavenly Hall, merging with the Flying Celestials in radiance, soaring through the clouds. The Divine King is the Wondrously Accomplished Heavenly King, named Yu Sheng, who governs the Flying Celestial deities of the ten directions. The Feathered Forest Inspector, named Miao Xue, knows the celestial sounds of Heaven, and is called the Earth’s Only One in the Three Realms. He attends to the luminous spirits and ghosts, naturally perceiving all, flying through the Three Realms, and roaming in the Upper Clarity.

**Youqi states:** Having equaled the years of Heaven and merged form with the Dao, one forever escapes the servitude of the Three Paths and the exile of the Five Sufferings; one transcends the Eight Difficulties in the demonic realms and ascends to the true domain of the Nine Heavens. The Three Paths are: first, the Path of Eternal Night; second, the Path of the Frigid Pool; third, the Path of Carrying Stones. The Five Sufferings are: first, the Suffering of Knife Mountains; second, the Suffering of Sword Trees; third, the Suffering of Cauldrons of Boiling Water; fourth, the Suffering of Furnace Coals; fifth, the Suffering of Interrogation and Exile. The Eight Difficulties comprise the Three Paths and Five Sufferings.

**Shaowei states:** The Three Paths are the servitudes of the Three Officials. The first is the servitude of the Heavenly Official, racing thunder and lightning; the second is the servitude of the Earthly Official, carrying mountains and stones; the third is the servitude of the Water Official, hauling and drawing from the dark seas. The Five Sufferings are: climbing knife mountains, treading sword trees, entering cauldrons of boiling water, embracing bronze pillars, and swallowing fire and eating coals. The Eight Difficulties are the eight gates of profound and desolate hardship, which the Dao Lord inquired about and the Flying Celestials answered. The Heaven of Upper Clarity is where the Heavenly Emperor and Jade Perfected dwell, in the colorless radiance of ascetic practice.

chunks.original_text: 东曰：上清之天，有天帝玉真，字陁与。 五篇真文，结炁俱明，在云阿之岭，号曰妙成之天者是也。 玉真在上清之天，不参色界，乘大梵之炁，游行入太黄皇曾之天也。 ○幽栖曰：上清之天，天帝即三十六天帝最尊极之位，道齐元始，位列玉清，故云玉真，此即上清。 已下四境，境有九天，四九合三十六天，此不同三十二天也。 无色天景则有景无色，故云梵行。 此后即明后四方之天，方有八天，四八合三十二天，谓之四梵天也。 景者，身也。 色者，质也。 言三十二天，上帝高尊形相，宛然有景无质，虽有真相，犹如虚空出入无间，不阂於物，故云梵行。 梵者，道中之道也。 此三清五境三十六天，谓之大罗四方。 四梵三十二天内，种民四天，谓之中罗。 其欲、色、无色三界，二十八天谓之小罗也。 ○少微曰：上清天帝名玉真，字陁与，号曰紫晨天帝君。 不参色界，无有三景，故曰无色之景。 唯有大梵之炁，流行混成，图云诸天，各有一日一月。 上清至大罗，自生九色光明，不假日月，故谓无色之景梵行也。 太黄皇曾天，帝郁褴玉明。 东曰：东第一，属清微天，帝位元阳之黑。 ○少微曰：此天色黄，炁系西北方梵炁，帝讳观觉，主张生箓。 天中人寿九百万岁，六根俱染，是名欲界。 ○玄英曰：凡言梵炁者，皆是四维之天。 维是角也。 其四方正面之天，名系二十八宿之炁； 其四维之天，不属正宿，但得两边宿炁相假而成，故云梵炁。 梵是泛杂之名，无系着之貌也。 如皇曾一天，承奎壁二宿之炁，故云梵炁。 已下三天仿此其三十二天之中，天人寿命从此天向上，每天皆一倍因之，数可知矣。 又从皇曾已下三十二天经文之中，从天字向上皆是其天之称号，从帝字向下，即是天帝之号也。 太明玉完天，帝须阿那田。 东曰：东第二，属禹余天，帝位上阳之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色绿，炁系北方壁宿，帝讳揽觉，主度魂更生。 天中人寿一千八百万岁，一欲根粗净，五欲根粗染。 清明何童天，帝元育齐京。 东曰：东第三，属大赤天，帝位太阳之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色黑，炁系北方室宿，帝讳大觉，主敷布政教，度脱天人。 天中人寿三千六百万岁，二欲根粗净，四欲根粗染。 玄胎平育天，帝刘度内鲜。 东曰：东第四，属元景天，帝位九天第一清阳无。 ○少微曰：此天色赤，炁系北方危宿，帝讳育王，主召魔举仙。 天中人寿七千二百万岁，三欲根粗净，三欲根粗染。 元明文举天，帝丑法轮。 东曰：东第五，属无量寿天，帝位九天第二洞阳炁。 ○少微曰：此天色苍，炁系北方虚宿，帝讳梵云，主通行元炁。 天中人寿一万四千四百万岁，四欲根粗净，二欲根粗染。 上明七曜摩夷天，帝恬懀延。 东曰：东第六，属上监天，帝位通阳之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色黑，炁系北方须女宿，帝讳玉真，主开度幽难。 天中人寿二万八千八百万岁，五欲根粗净，一欲根粗染。 以上六天，谓之欲界。 《太真科》曰：初下二天，果报尚粗，犹以身交为欲； 次二天以执手为欲，第五天以口说为欲； 第六天以眼视为欲。 今缘六欲感此六天，一根粗净，上进一天，六欲总净，超出欲界，上登色界。 宗君曰：言有色欲，交接阴阳，人民胎生，故为欲界也。

**Dong states:** In the Heaven of Upper Clarity, there resides the Heavenly Emperor Jade Perfected, whose name is Tuoyu. The Five Chapters of True Writ, bound with luminous qi, dwell upon the Cloud Alas Ridge, known as the Heaven of Wondrous Completion.

The Jade Perfected in the Heaven of Upper Clarity does not partake in the realm of form, riding the great qi of Brahman to roam and enter the Heaven of Supreme Yellow Emperor Zeng.

**Youxi remarks:** In the Heaven of Upper Clarity, the Heavenly Emperor occupies the most exalted position among the thirty-six Heavenly Emperors, his Dao equal to that of the Primordial Beginning, his rank aligned with the Jade Clarity. Thus he is called Jade Perfected, and this is the Upper Clarity. Below this lie four realms, each containing nine heavens, four nines combining to form thirty-six heavens—distinct from the thirty-two heavens. The formless heavens possess radiance without color, hence termed "Brahmanic practice." Following this are the heavens of the four subsequent directions, each direction comprising eight heavens, four eights combining to form thirty-two heavens, called the Four Brahman Heavens. *Jing* refers to the body; *se* refers to substance. Speaking of the thirty-two heavens, the Supreme Thearchs, though lofty and revered in form, possess radiance without substance. Though they bear true appearances, they move through the void without obstruction, unobstructed by things, hence termed "Brahmanic practice." Brahman is the Dao within the Dao. These Three Clarities, five realms, and thirty-six heavens are called the Great Luo of the Four Directions. Within the Four Brahman and thirty-two heavens, the Four Heavens of Seed People are called the Middle Luo. The three realms of desire, form, and formlessness, comprising twenty-eight heavens, are called the Lesser Luo.

**Shaowei states:** The Heavenly Emperor of Upper Clarity is named Jade Perfected, styled Tuoyu, and titled the Purple Dawn Heavenly Thearch. He does not partake in the realm of form, possessing no Three Radiance, hence called "radiance without color." Only the great qi of Brahman flows and blends, mapping the heavens in clouds. Each heaven possesses its own sun and moon. From Upper Clarity to the Great Luo, nine-colored luminosity arises spontaneously, independent of sun and moon, thus termed "radiance without color in Brahmanic practice."

In the Heaven of Supreme Yellow Emperor Zeng, the Emperor is Yulan Yuming.

**Dong states:** The first heaven of the East belongs to the Heaven of Pure Tenuity, where the Emperor’s position is the Black of Primordial Yang.

**Shaowei remarks:** This heaven is yellow in color, its qi linked to the Brahman qi of the northwest. The Emperor’s taboo name is Guanjue, overseeing the Register of Life. The people of this heaven live for nine million years, their six roots all tainted—this is called the Realm of Desire.

**Xuanying states:** Whenever Brahman qi is mentioned, it refers to the heavens of the four corners. *Wei* means "corner." The heavens of the four cardinal directions are named after the qi of the twenty-eight constellations; the heavens of the four corners do not belong to the cardinal constellations but borrow the qi of the adjacent constellations to form, hence termed Brahman qi. Brahman is a name denoting mixture and lack of fixed attachment. For example, the Heaven of Emperor Zeng draws upon the qi of the Kui and Bi constellations, hence called Brahman qi. The three heavens below follow this pattern. Among the thirty-two heavens, the lifespans of heavenly beings increase by onefold with each ascent from this heaven upward—this pattern is self-evident. Furthermore, in the scriptures of the thirty-two heavens from Emperor Zeng downward, the text preceding "heaven" denotes the name of the heaven, while the text following "Emperor" denotes the title of the Heavenly Emperor.

In the Heaven of Great Brilliance and Jade Perfection, the Emperor is Xu’anatian.

**Dong states:** The second heaven of the East belongs to the Heaven of Yu Remnant, where the Emperor’s position is the qi of Upper Yang.

**Shaowei remarks:** This heaven is green in color, its qi linked to the Bi constellation of the north. The Emperor’s taboo name is Lanjue, overseeing the rebirth of souls. The people of this heaven live for eighteen million years, one desire-root roughly purified, five desire-roots roughly tainted.

In the Heaven of Luminous Clarity and Harmonious Youth, the Emperor is Yuanyu Qijing.

**Dong states:** The third heaven of the East belongs to the Heaven of Great Red, where the Emperor’s position is the qi of Great Yang.

**Shaowei remarks:** This heaven is black in color, its qi linked to the Shi constellation of the north. The Emperor’s taboo name is Dajue, overseeing the propagation of governance and teachings, liberating heavenly beings. The people of this heaven live for thirty-six million years, two desire-roots roughly purified, four desire-roots roughly tainted.

In the Heaven of Mysterious Womb and Peaceful Nurturance, the Emperor is Liu Dunneixian.

**Dong states:** The fourth heaven of the East belongs to the Heaven of Primordial Radiance, where the Emperor’s position is the First Clear Yang of the Nine Heavens.

**Shaowei remarks:** This heaven is red in color, its qi linked to the Wei constellation of the north. The Emperor’s taboo name is Yuwang, overseeing the summoning of demons and elevation of immortals. The people of this heaven live for seventy-two million years, three desire-roots roughly purified, three desire-roots roughly tainted.

In the Heaven of Primordial Brilliance and Literary Elevation, the Emperor is Chou Falun.

**Dong states:** The fifth heaven of the East belongs to the Heaven of Immeasurable Longevity, where the Emperor’s position is the Second Cavernous Yang of the Nine Heavens.

**Shaowei remarks:** This heaven is blue-green in color, its qi linked to the Xu constellation of the north. The Emperor’s taboo name is Fanyun, overseeing the circulation of primordial qi. The people of this heaven live for one hundred forty-four million years, four desire-roots roughly purified, two desire-roots roughly tainted.

In the Heaven of Upper Brilliance and Seven Luminaries’ Ma Yi, the Emperor is Tian Huaiyan.

**Dong states:** The sixth heaven of the East belongs to the Heaven of Upper Surveillance, where the Emperor’s position is the qi of Pervading Yang.

**Shaowei remarks:** This heaven is black in color, its qi linked to the Xunü constellation of the north. The Emperor’s taboo name is Yuzhen, overseeing the liberation of those in profound difficulty. The people of this heaven live for two hundred eighty-eight million years, five desire-roots roughly purified, one desire-root roughly tainted.

The above six heavens are called the Realm of Desire. The *Canons of the Supreme Perfected* state: In the first two heavens below, karmic retribution remains coarse, and desire is still expressed through bodily union; in the next two heavens, desire is expressed through holding hands; in the fifth heaven, through speech; and in the sixth heaven, through gaze. Now, due to the six desires, these six heavens are thus manifested. With one desire-root roughly purified, one ascends to the next heaven; when all six desires are wholly purified, one transcends the Realm of Desire and ascends to the Realm of Form.

**Zongjun states:** To speak of the Realm of Desire is to speak of beings with form and desire, who engage in the union of yin and yang, and are born of wombs—hence it is called the Realm of Desire.

chunks.original_text: 虚无越衡天，帝正定光。 东曰：东第七，属兜术天，帝位建阳之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色碧，炁系北方牵牛宿。 帝讳无上，主明无上之道。 天中人寿五万七千六百万岁，六色尘俱染，初出欲界，犹染色尘。 太极蒙翳天，帝曲育九昌。 东曰：东第八，属不骄乐天，帝属东方极阳之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色紫，炁系北方斗宿，帝讳吁员，主炼度朽骸。 天中人寿十一万五千二百万岁，一色尘粗净，五色尘粗染。 赤明和阳天，帝理禁上真。 东曰：南第一，属化应声天，帝位始阳之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色白，炁系东北方梵炁，在箕斗之间。 帝讳焕明，主炼仙成真。 天中人寿二十三万四百万岁，二色尘粗净，四色尘粗染。 玄明恭华天，帝空谣丑音。 东曰：南第二，属梵宝天帝，位阳晖之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色黄，炁系东方箕宿，帝讳世元主，应化一切。 天中人寿四十六万八百万岁，三色尘粗净，三色尘粗染。 耀明宗飘天，帝重光明。 东曰：南第三，属摩夷迦天，帝位洞阳之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色绿，炁系东方尾宿，帝讳落觉王，劫终纳学仙之人。 天中人寿九十二万一千六百万岁，四色尘粗净，二色尘粗染。 竺落皇笳天，帝摩夷妙辩。 东曰：南第四，属答和悲皇天，帝位阳明之炁。 少微曰：此天色青，炁系东方心宿，帝讳韶，主魔试学仙之人。 天中人寿一百八十四万三千二百万岁，五色尘粗净，一色尘粗染也。 ○玄英曰：此前六天是色尘之天，学者若修极此天，即色尘俱尽，超入细尘天中，谓下文也。 细尘有六天。 虚明堂曜天，帝阿娄生。 东曰：南第五，属梵明天，帝位阳演之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色赤，炁系东方房宿，帝讳云上，主开度天地。 天中人寿三百六十八万六千四百万岁，六色尘粗净，六细粗染。 观明端静天，帝郁密罗千。 东曰：南第六，属摩杂和天，帝位阳明之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色苍，炁系东方氐宿，帝讳净生，主度学者之身。 天中人寿七百三十七万二千八百万岁，一细尘净，五细尘染。 玄明恭庆天，帝龙罗菩提。 东曰：南第七，属亿罗天，帝位阳浩之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色黑，炁系东方亢宿，帝讳镜主，度得道之人。 天中人寿一千四百七十四万五千六百万岁，二细尘净，四细尘染。 太焕极瑶天，帝宛梨无延。 东曰：南第八，属那首明天，帝位阳极之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色碧，炁系东方角宿，帝讳廓奕，主教学仙之人。 天中人寿二千九百四十九万一千二百万岁，三细尘净，三细尘染。 元载孔升天，帝开真定光。 东曰：西第一，属染梨恭首天，帝位少阳之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色紫，炁系东南方梵炁，在轸角之间，帝讳猷，主炼度死魂更生。 天中人寿五千八百九十八万二千四百万岁，四细尘净，二细尘染。 太安皇崖天，帝婆娄阿贪。 东曰：西第二，属首来天，帝位太阳之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色白，炁系南方轸宿，帝讳宛，主开度善人。 天中人寿一万一千七百九十六万四千八百万岁，五细尘净，一细尘染。 ○玄英曰：此前六天是细尘之天，学者修极此天，即细尘都尽，升入轻尘天中，谓下文也。 轻尘有六天。 显定极风天，帝招真童。 东曰：西第三，属首为稽那天，帝位浩阳之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色黄，无系南方翼宿，帝讳流，主度有善功之魂。

chunks.original_text: 天中人寿二万三千五百九十二万九千六百万岁，六细尘净，六轻尘染。 始黄孝芒天，帝萨罗娄王。 东曰：西第四，属阿那波逻迦天，帝位洞阴之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色绿，炁系南方张宿，帝讳易邈，主披夜开幽。 天中人寿四万七千一百八十五万九千二百万岁，一轻尘净，五轻尘染。 太黄翕重浮容天，帝闵巴狂。 东曰：西第五，属波罗离和天，帝位开阴之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色青，无系南方星宿，帝讳阿滥，主召魔集真。 天中人寿九万四千三百七十一万八千四百万岁，二轻尘净，四轻尘染。 无思江由天，帝明梵光。 东曰：西第六，属梵明元黄天，帝位玄阴之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色赤，炁系南方柳宿，帝讳阿丘，主开度善魂。 天中人寿一十八万八千七百四十三万六千八百万岁，三轻尘净，三轻尘染。 上揲阮乐天，帝勃勃监。 东曰：西第七，属蔡泞元天，帝位昊阴之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色苍，炁系南方鬼宿，帝讳无量，主品类天人等级。 天中人寿三十七万七千四百八十七万三千六百万岁，四轻尘净，二轻尘染。 ○玄英曰：等级者，贵贱贫富寿命也。 无极昙誓天，帝飘弩穹隆。 东曰：西第八，属天阿梨和天，帝位极阴之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色黑，炁系南方井宿，帝讳昙，主度一切仙人。 天中人寿七十五万四千九百七十四万七千二百万岁，五轻尘净，一轻尘染。 以上十八天谓之色界。 《太真科》曰：无色界之中，至真无情，不交阴阳，人民化生，但啖香炁，无复形质之患也。 ○玄英曰：然此前一十八天，通名色界。 若从此天升上，即至无色界天，形色都无，亦得同彼天人寿命。 前明色界天中，犹有轻尘为累，此明无色之界，形相都无，学者修至此天，唯存心识，以入炁观。 皓庭霄度天，帝慧觉昏。 东曰：北第一，属阿答和天，帝位阴生之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色碧，炁系西南方梵炁，在参井之问，帝讳育，主拔度学人。 天中人寿一百五十万九千九百四十九万四千四百万岁，色尘俱净，形相都如虚空也。 唯存心识，以入炁观。 炁观道成，即升入元洞天也。 渊通元洞天，帝梵行观生。 东曰：北第二，属扇明民天，帝位阴化之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色紫，炁系西方参宿，帝讳上，主度学仙之人。 天中人寿三百一万九千八百九十八万八千八百万岁，尚有心识劳动，便作舍识意修，得生妙成天也。 ○玄英曰：又以心识为息，若能舍除心识，以至无为，即得升入妙成天中也。 太文翰宠妙成天，帝那育丑瑛。 东曰：北第三，属梨那天，帝位阴明之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色白，炁系西方觜宿，帝讳陀，主统理神王。 天中人寿六百三万九千七百九十七万七千六百万岁，前因都忘，心识即居此天。 此天不使都忘，故应用即有，不为即无，若有若无，即升禁上天也。 ○玄英曰：此天不使兼忘，若令空有都无，即失真中之应。 以其空中有真，真中有应，生成万象，皆出於空； 万法在心，亦无形相，应用则有，有即非无。 将令学者观心若有若无，即生禁上天也。 太素秀乐禁上天，帝龙罗觉长。 东曰：北第四，属明梵括大招天，帝位阴洞之炁。 ○少微日：此天色黄，炁系西方毕宿，帝讳隗，主领录魔王。 天中人寿一千二百七万九千五百九十五万五千二百万岁，炁观转妙，结习都忘，若洞入自然，即升居种民天也。

chunks.original_text: 以上四天谓之无色界。 《太真科》曰：无色界中，人身微妙，无复形色； 或复形长数百丈而人不见，唯真人能见之。 以其无形可见，故云无色。 但三界之人，生死之根未断，阴阳之炁犹存，故有寿尽之数，或升入上境，或下生人中，随功厚薄，轮转无穷，得道乃已也。 ○玄英曰：此四天是无色界天，修学之者若至此天，更能进修即生四种民天也。 太虚无上常融天，帝总监鬼神。 东曰：北第五，属阿尼姤天，帝位阴灵之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色绿，炁系西方易宿，帝讳极，主校学者之功。 天中人寿二千四百一十五万九千一百九十一万四百万岁，初出三界，清净无染，喜乐无为也。 太释玉隆腾胜天，帝眇眇行元。 东曰：北第六，属须达天，帝位阴魂之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色青，无系西方胃宿，帝讳浮黎，主召集仙圣。 天中人寿四千八百三十一万八千三百八十二万八百万岁。 龙变梵度天，帝运上玄玄。 东曰：北第七，属元梵须带太昏天，帝位阴结之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色赤，炁系西方娄宿。 帝讳恶奕，主进仙成圣。 天中人寿九千六百六十三万六千七百六十四万一千六百万岁，随炁升降，无复结习。 太极平育贾奕天，帝大择法门。 东曰：北第八，属释婵自然天，帝位阴极之炁。 ○少微曰：此天色苍，炁系西方奎宿，帝讳精上，主度学者之身。 天中人寿一万九千三百二十七万三千五百二十八万三千二百万岁。 以上四天为四民天，亦谓之种民天。 一云此四天人出二炁之外，无年寿之限，喜乐清净也。 《本际经》云：结习已尽，超种民位。 谓烦恼为结，学业为习。 《太真科》曰：上升四天，洞入道境，随炁升降，灾所不及。 以上三十二炁及系星宿、帝讳、主掌皆见《洞神经》，人寿岁数、根尘染净见《龙蹻经》。 三十二天，三十二帝， 东曰：四八三十二天也，内名隐讳，皆多相类，梵语难解，别有诀解； 凡有三十二天，各有一帝，合为三十二帝。 诸天隐讳，诸天隐名， 东曰：经中所说并是诸天内名隐讳者也。 ○幽栖曰：此四方之天，即东方九炁青天，南方三炁舟天，西方七炁素天，北方五炁玄天。 一方八天，四八三十二天也。 在三景之上，九宫之下。 四极之方与四维上下，通为十方。 其天名、帝号既称隐讳、隐名，不可注释。 ○少微曰：隐讳，帝讳； 隐名，天名也。 天中空洞自然灵章。 东曰：空，玄也。 洞，虚也。 灵章，玉字也。 玄虚之中有自然玉字，故云灵章也。 ○幽栖曰：言此经是太极空洞之真词，虚无自然之灵奥者也。 ○少微曰：空洞灵章即八会灵书，自然玉字也。 本其所出，皆结空洞之炁，自然成章，非世上言词，是诸天音韵也。 ○玄英曰：空洞者，谓诸天太空虚无之中也。 灵者，即八会灵文、自然玉字是也。 章者，言词合会，荫映成文，谓之为章。 八会者，八方之炁也。 自然者，明此灵章之本迹，皆结空洞之中，八方真妙之炁，灵风鼓奏，自然成此言章，非因造作而成，故曰自然灵章也。 诸天隐韵，天中之音。 东曰：韵，调也。 音，章也。 诸天各有八字之章，隐其调韵，文旨玄奥，难可寻详，故曰隐韵也。 ○幽栖曰：亦是诸天隐微之韵，十方幽秘之音也。 ○玄英曰：音，荫也。 单出为声，五声相荫而成文，谓之音。

The above four heavens are called the Formless Realm. *The Great Perfection Regulations* states: In the Formless Realm, human bodies are subtle and wondrous, no longer possessing form or color. Some may grow hundreds of *zhang* in height yet remain unseen by ordinary people—only perfected beings can perceive them. Since no visible form exists, it is called the Formless Realm. However, beings within the Three Realms have not severed the root of birth and death, and the qi of yin and yang still lingers, thus their lifespans remain finite. Some ascend to higher realms, while others descend into the human world, endlessly revolving according to the depth of their merit until they attain the Dao.

**Xuan Ying remarks:** These four heavens constitute the Formless Realm. If cultivators reach this realm and continue their practice, they may be reborn into the Four Seed People Heavens.

**Great Void Supreme Constant Fusion Heaven**, where the Emperor oversees the supervision of ghosts and spirits.
**Dong states:** The fifth heaven of the North, belonging to the Anigou Heaven, where the Emperor’s throne is established by the qi of numinous yin.
**Shaowei remarks:** This heaven is green in hue, its qi linked to the Yi constellation of the West. The Emperor’s name is Ji, and he governs the assessment of cultivators’ merits. The inhabitants of this heaven live for 2,415,919,104,000,000 years. Having just emerged from the Three Realms, they are pure and unstained, delighting in effortless non-action.

**Great Release Jade Ascension Soaring Victory Heaven**, where the Emperor is named Miao Miao Xing Yuan.
**Dong states:** The sixth heaven of the North, belonging to the Xuda Heaven, where the Emperor’s throne is established by the qi of ethereal yin.
**Shaowei remarks:** This heaven is blue-green in hue, its qi linked to the Wei constellation of the West. The Emperor’s name is Fu Li, and he governs the summoning of immortals and sages. The inhabitants of this heaven live for 4,831,838,208,000,000 years.

**Dragon Transformation Brahman Passage Heaven**, where the Emperor is named Yun Shang Xuan Xuan.
**Dong states:** The seventh heaven of the North, belonging to the Yuanfan Xudai Taihun Heaven, where the Emperor’s throne is established by the qi of congealed yin.
**Shaowei remarks:** This heaven is crimson in hue, its qi linked to the Lou constellation of the West. The Emperor’s name is E Yi, and he governs the advancement of immortals to sagehood. The inhabitants of this heaven live for 9,663,676,416,000,000 years, ascending and descending with the qi, free from all habitual tendencies.

**Great Ultimate Nurturing Jia Yi Heaven**, where the Emperor is named Da Ze Fa Men.
**Dong states:** The eighth heaven of the North, belonging to the Shichan Ziran Heaven, where the Emperor’s throne is established by the qi of ultimate yin.
**Shaowei remarks:** This heaven is dark green in hue, its qi linked to the Kui constellation of the West. The Emperor’s name is Jing Shang, and he governs the deliverance of cultivators’ bodies. The inhabitants of this heaven live for 19,327,352,832,000,000 years.

The above four heavens are the Four Seed People Heavens, also called the Seed People Heavens. Some say the inhabitants of these four heavens exist beyond the dual qi of yin and yang, unbound by lifespan limits, delighting in purity and tranquility. *The Sutra of Original Boundary* states: "When habitual tendencies are exhausted, one transcends the rank of the Seed People." Here, "entanglements" refer to afflictions, and "habits" to learned practices. *The Great Perfection Regulations* states: "Ascending to these four heavens, one thoroughly enters the realm of the Dao, rising and falling with the qi, beyond the reach of calamity."

The thirty-two qi, their corresponding constellations, the Emperors’ names, and their governance are all recorded in *The Scripture of Cavernous Spirit*. The lifespans of the inhabitants and the purity or defilement of their roots and senses are found in *The Scripture of the Dragon’s Stride*.

Thirty-two heavens, thirty-two Emperors.
**Dong states:** Four times eight makes thirty-two heavens. Their names and taboo titles are often similar, difficult to interpret in Sanskrit, with separate oral instructions. Each of the thirty-two heavens has its own Emperor, totaling thirty-two Emperors. The taboo titles and hidden names of the heavens—
**Dong states:** What is spoken of in the scriptures are the hidden names and taboo titles of the heavens.
**Youxi remarks:** These heavens of the four directions are: the Nine Qi Blue Heaven of the East, the Three Qi Boat Heaven of the South, the Seven Qi White Heaven of the West, and the Five Qi Mysterious Heaven of the North. Each direction has eight heavens, making four times eight, thirty-two heavens. They reside above the Three Luminaries and below the Nine Palaces. The four cardinal directions, four corners, above and below together form the Ten Directions. Since the names of the heavens and the titles of the Emperors are termed "hidden names" and "taboo titles," they cannot be annotated.

Within the heavens, the numinous chapters arise spontaneously in the void.
**Dong states:** "Void" means profound; "cavernous" means empty. "Numinous chapters" are jade scripts. Within the profound emptiness exist spontaneous jade scripts, hence called "numinous chapters."
**Youxi remarks:** This scripture is the true word of the Great Ultimate’s emptiness and cavernousness, the numinous mystery of spontaneity and non-being.
**Shaowei remarks:** The "cavernous numinous chapters" are the Eightfold Convergence of Numinous Writings, the spontaneous jade scripts. In their origin, they coalesce from the qi of emptiness and cavernousness, forming spontaneously—not the language of the mundane world, but the tonal rhythms of the heavens.
**Xuan Ying remarks:** "Cavernous" refers to the vast emptiness within the heavens. "Numinous" denotes the Eightfold Convergence of Numinous Writings and the spontaneous jade scripts. "Chapters" are the harmonious convergence of words, their radiance interweaving into patterns. The "Eightfold Convergence" refers to the qi of the eight directions. "Spontaneous" clarifies that the origin of these numinous chapters lies in the coalescence of the true and wondrous qi of the eight directions within the emptiness and cavernousness, where the numinous winds stir and play, naturally forming these words and chapters—not crafted by deliberate effort, hence called "spontaneous numinous chapters."

The hidden rhythms of the heavens are the celestial sounds.
**Dong states:** "Rhythms" are melodies; "sounds" are chapters. Each heaven possesses an eight-character chapter, its melodies and rhythms concealed. The text is profound and abstruse, difficult to trace in detail, hence called "hidden rhythms."
**Youxi remarks:** These are also the subtle hidden rhythms of the heavens, the esoteric sounds of the Ten Directions.
**Xuan Ying remarks:** "Sounds" are echoes. A single emission is a voice; the interweaving of the five tones forms patterns, called "sounds."

chunks.original_text: 《礼记乐记》曰：声成文，谓之音。 天中之尊，天中之神。 东曰：天中亦有至尊，又有大神也。 ○幽栖曰：尊者即三十二天之帝尊，神者即十方飞天之神王也。 天中大魔，天中之灵。 东曰：大魔者，即三界魔王也，灵即司命司录、监度诸灵官也。 九和十合，变化上清。 东曰：和，解也。 合，会也。 天王昔在龙汉之中，诸缘并尽，而得过度三界之庭，身入太虚之馆，受九仙炼度而得进大圣之号。 赤明开运，元始锡为梵度天王，奕奕而升灵门，上登玉清之宫也。 ○幽栖曰：此明诸天神灵、大魔皆是举度之主，录籍之司。 若九和十合，共相保举，立能应时变化，飞登上清也。 ○少微曰：尊是上圣高尊也，神是飞天神王也，大魔是三界魔王也，灵是五帝灵章也。 玉字所出，是尊神魔灵，和九炁之精，合十方之音，变化上清之天，流布三十二境。 《玉诀》云：五帝灵章、五帝真文、五老同生，统九天之炁也。 ○玄英曰：此明真文玉字之缘起，皆是诸天上＇圣之高尊，及飞天大神，三界魔王、五方大帝等，和九炁之精，合十方之音，变化上清天中之妙，流布三十二天，成其灵章之文也。 九炁者，九天之炁也。 无量之奥，深不可详。 东曰：奥，隐也。 详，审也。 无量之文，其义隐奥，难可详审也。 ○幽栖曰：此经既能变凡入圣，炼粗入妙，乃出离五浊，飞步三清，则幽奥难详，忘言理绝。 敷落神真，普度天人。 东曰：敷，布也。 落，置也。 元始随运度人，布置神真，以立三十二天，安镇五岳，普度天人也。 ○幽栖曰：敷，张也。 落，廓也。 敷张开设之貌，廓落广大之旨，言此经神真仙化，敷张廓落，人间天上，普度无穷。 ○玄英曰：言天尊布落玉策真文，普度天人神鬼也。 今日欣庆受度，历关诸天。 东曰：道君昔於始青天中，宝珠之内，受十部妙经。 元始尔时引十方大圣，飞天神王、无鞅之众，俱入宝珠之中，说经都竟，众真监度以授道君。 当尔之时，喜庆难言，三十二天．普遍关盟； 十方国土并皆受度，恶对罪根，一时开赦也。 ○ 　　幽栖曰：既沐神真监举，则永赖升度之恩。 上关三十二天，下告九幽之府，此时 欣庆，何可胜言也。 请灭三恶，斩绝地根， 东曰：三恶，三徒也。 第一色欲，第二爱欲，第三贪欲，为三恶门也。 地根，地狱也。 请灭三恶之道，斩绝地狱之根也。 飞度五户，名列太玄， 东曰：五户，五道门也。 前章已说，今重再解。 一色累苦心，二爱累苦神，三贪累苦形，四华竞苦精，五身累苦魂。 出门由户，故云户耳。 太玄，太玄都也。 人禀自然，阴阳淳和，无欲不履三恶、五欲，飞度五苦之门，径升玄都之宫也。 ○幽栖曰：五户者，五道之门户。 五道者，以前三恶加以故炁、人道，共为五道。 既斩绝三恶之趋，复超五道之门，则酆都落鬼录之名，太玄克仙籍之简。 太玄即玄中九宫、上清之境。 魔王监举，无拘天门。 东曰：拘，碍也。 人得魔王保举，径升三清，得经天门，无所拘碍，逍遥上清也。 ○少微曰：天尊赐升天之券，魔王保举而奉之，所到天门，无敢拘碍执问也。 《洞神经升天券》出人皇文中第六十八字，以青素书带身。 道士临升天之日，五岳不得此券，则拘入魂魄，不使同升；
